intro: Psychotria paracalensis, commonly known as the Amazonian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests, where it thrives in humid and shaded conditions. The plant is also noted for its role in traditional medicine among indigenous communities.
